title: Photography
text: A small collection of some of my activities with good people and good science.

title: Projects
text:
Chengyu Liang Lab
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and The relationship between UV exposure and melanoma incidence is well established, current estimates suggest 60 - 70% of melanoma contains UV-induced DNA damage. UVRAG is a tumor suppressor protein with important functions in melanogenesis and DNA repair. A loss-of-function mutant has been previously validated by our lab to result in severe DNA repair deficiency resulting in damage accumulation with UVC irradiation. This project explores the UVRAG protecting role against UVB induced DNA damage using irradiated syngeneic models which better recapitulate human melanoma pathogenesis. Results indicated UVRAG had no effect on tumor mass or onset in non-irradiated lines. However, irradiated UVRAG wild-type tumors were significantly smaller with later onset compared to UVRAG defective mutant; moreover, this disparity was exacerbated in the immune-compromised mice. The implications of these findings support UVRAG and DNA repair fidelity as an indicator of melanoma prognosis in patients and a predisposing factor for UV associated genetic instability.

title: Projects
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

title: Projects
section: The History of the War of the Ring
text:
The History of the War of the Ring

arXiv Preprint | Code
I am creating a comprehensive and detailed history of the conflict that goes beyond the surface-level events. By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earth’s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.

View the tutorial for this template (+ download link)

title: Welcome
text:
Welcome
I am currently a PhD student in Doug Brubaker’s lab with research focused in women’s reproductive health. My main project is focused on developing computational tools to better translate observations from preclinical in vitro and animal models to human in vivo and clinical contexts. My focus is currently on translation of data from preclinical models of the endometrium with relevance to endometriosis biology and therapeutic development. My side project is focused on identifying Tenofovir-associated gene signatures in vaginal microbiome. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.

text:
Chengyu Liang Lab

title: Projects
section: The effect of TFEB upregulation in melanoma
text:
The effect of TFEB upregulation in melanoma
Chengyu Liang Lab
TFEB is a master transcription factor of autophagy-lysosomal function and has been observed to have both tumor suppressive and tumor supportive roles with different types of cancers. We hypothesized that TFEB inhibition may contribute to oncogenic growth in melanomas. To test this hypothesis we used a tamoxifen-inducible TFEB syngeneic model with subcutaneously injected melanoma cell lines. My results indicated TFEB overexpression led to significantly smaller tumor sizes and no difference in survival rate between the two groups. The implications of these results may support pharmacological activation of TFEB as a therapeutic approach to improve current treatments for melanoma patients.
Publications Quach C, Song Y, Guo H, Li S, Maazi H, Fung M, Sands N, O’Connell D, Restrepo-Vassalli S, Chai B, Nemecio D, Punj V, Akbari O, Idos GE, Mumenthaler SM, Wu N, Martin SE, Hagiya A, Hicks J, Cui H, Liang C. A truncating mutation in the autophagy gene UVRAG drives inflammation and tumorigenesis in mice. Nat Commun. 2019 Dec 12;10(1):5681. doi: 10.1038/s41467-019-13475-w. PMID: 31831743; PMCID: PMC6908726.
Li S, Song Y, Quach C, Nemecio D, Liang C. Revisiting the role of autophagy in melanoma. Autophagy. 2019 Oct;15(10):1843-1844. doi: 10.1080/15548627.2019.1635386. Epub 2019 Jun 29. PMID: 31242070; PMCID: PMC6735499.
Zhu Q, Wang R, Nemecio D, Liang C. How autophagy is tied to inflammation and cancer. Mol Cell Oncol. 2020 Feb 4;7(2):1717908. doi: 10.1080/23723556.2020.1717908. PMID: 32158928; PMCID: PMC7051155.

title: Projects
section: Exploring Zelda’s function in Central Nervous System Development
text:
Exploring Zelda’s function in Central Nervous System Development
Christine Rushlow Lab
Zelda is a master transcription factor required for early embryogenesis in Drosophila that localizes to the central nervous system (CNS) during mid to late stages. However the precise role of Zelda in CNS development was unknown. We explored this using RNA interference and “enhancer trap” P-insertion elements to disrupt Zelda expression and potentially locate the CNS enhancer. Results indicated that two of the six P element lines had higher reporter gene specificity to the CNS and were within 600bp of each other, supporting the conclusion that they may lie within proximity of the CNS enhancer for Zelda. This research expands on the known properties of Zelda, which has been proven to be analogous to that in other organisms during their respective embryonic development, and therefore has broader applications to the developmental field.
